meanings.definition: The state or quality of being still or quiet.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful stillnesses of the forest were interrupted by a chirping bird.
meanings.sent2: The stillnesses of the library were broken by the sound of a dropped book.
meanings.sent3: The stillnesses of the classroom were shattered by a sudden sneeze.
meanings.sent4: In the stillnesses of the night, even the smallest sound seemed magnified.
meanings.sent5: The stillnesses of the desert at noon were almost tangible in the scorching heat.

meanings.definition: Plural form of stillness, referring to multiple instances of stillness.
meanings.sent1: The different stillnesses in the art gallery created a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The various stillnesses in the park made it a perfect spot for meditation.
meanings.sent3: The many stillnesses in the room made it feel like time had stopped.
meanings.sent4: Among the stillnesses of the museum, each artwork seemed to come alive.
meanings.sent5: The countless stillnesses in the garden were a haven for contemplation.
